pt.investors.faq.title: Perguntas Frequentes
pt.investors.faq.subtitle: Respostas diretas para GPs, Partners e Investment Teams
pt.investors.faq.q1: Como funciona o modelo de engajamento com portfolio companies?
pt.investors.faq.a1: Atuamos como Fractional CRO dedicado, com 2 dias por semana de envolvimento direto na opera√ß√£o. O engajamento t√≠pico √© de 6-12 meses, tempo suficiente para instalar a arquitetura de receita e treinar o time interno para operar de forma aut√¥noma. Diferente de consultoria tradicional, entramos na execu√ß√£o: participamos de calls com clientes, estruturamos o pipeline, definimos m√©tricas e constru√≠mos os processos junto com o time.
pt.investors.faq.q2: Qual o perfil ideal de portfolio company para este servi√ßo?
pt.investors.faq.a2: Melhor fit: B2B Tech com produto validado (clientes pagantes e renovando), receita entre R$5M-50M ARR, e crescimento estagnado h√° 6+ meses apesar de bom produto. Sinais claros: Founder sobrecarregado em vendas, pipeline inconsistente, ciclo de vendas alongando, CAC subindo sem explica√ß√£o clara. N√£o √© fit: Empresas pre-product-market-fit, B2C, ou que precisam de pivot de produto (n√£o de GTM).
pt.investors.faq.q3: Como √© a estrutura de pricing e incentivos?
pt.investors.faq.a3: Modelo h√≠brido: retainer mensal + success fee atrelado a m√©tricas acordadas (tipicamente crescimento de pipeline qualificado ou receita). O retainer cobre o tempo dedicado; o success fee alinha incentivos. Kill-switch: Se n√£o houver progresso mensur√°vel em 90 dias, qualquer parte pode encerrar sem penalidade.
pt.investors.faq.q4: Qual a diferen√ßa entre Fractional CRO e contratar um VP de Vendas?
pt.investors.faq.a4: VP de Vendas: 12-18 meses de ramp, custo de R$800K-1.5M/ano all-in, 50%+ taxa de falha em startups. Ideal quando j√° existe arquitetura de receita funcionando. Fractional CRO: Resultado em 90 dias, ~30% do custo de um VP, traz playbook testado. Ideal para construir a arquitetura antes de contratar o VP. Na pr√°tica: Fractional CRO constr√≥i a m√°quina, depois ajuda a contratar e fazer onboarding do VP que vai operar.
pt.investors.faq.q5: Como funciona o reporting para o fundo?
pt.investors.faq.a5: Relat√≥rio mensal estruturado com: m√©tricas de pipeline (volume, velocidade, convers√£o), a√ß√µes executadas, blockers identificados, e plano para pr√≥ximo m√™s. Call trimestral com o board member respons√°vel para alinhamento estrat√©gico. Transpar√™ncia total ‚Äî o fundo tem visibilidade completa do que est√° sendo feito e dos resultados.
pt.investors.faq.q6: Voc√™s podem atuar em mais de uma portfolio company simultaneamente?
pt.investors.faq.a6: Sim, mas com limite. M√°ximo de 3 empresas simult√¢neas para garantir profundidade de execu√ß√£o. Para fundos com m√∫ltiplas portfolio companies precisando de suporte, podemos discutir um modelo de parceria com prioridade de aloca√ß√£o e condi√ß√µes especiais.

en.why.case.title: ClearSale: Sales Structuring at the Beginning of the Journey
en.why.case.step1.title: The Challenge
en.why.case.step1.text: ClearSale had a validated product but needed to structure its sales operation to scale. Carlos Andr√© participated in defining and selecting the commercial leadership, serving as a close mentor to the operation.
en.why.case.step2.title: The Mentorship
en.why.case.step2.text: Strategic mentorship in structuring the commercial architecture: support in defining processes, pipeline, metrics and cadence. Close guidance that helped transform the sales operation into a predictable revenue machine.
en.why.case.step3.title: The Trajectory
en.why.case.step3.text: ClearSale became Brazil's anti-fraud leader, went public on B3 in 2021, and was acquired by Serasa Experian for R$2 billion (~$400M) in 2025.
en.why.case.book.title: Documented in the book #VQD ‚Äî Vai Que D√°!
en.why.case.book.detail: Endeavor Brazil / Portfolio Penguin, 2014. ClearSale chapter, with forewords by Jorge Paulo Lemann and Beto Sicupira.
en.why.case.takeaway: What this means for you: The gap between validated product and scalable growth is almost always a commercial architecture problem. We've solved it before ‚Äî and we can solve it for your company.
en.why.founder.name: Carlos Andr√©
en.why.founder.title: Founding Partner | Former Oracle Brazil President | Former AT&T LATAM CEO
en.why.founder.quote: B2B organizations from $3M to $240M+ ‚Äî built, not advised. With founder and operator experience, I created Alavanka to deliver this at scale.

en.faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
en.faq.a1: A Fractional CRO is a senior revenue executive who works part-time for your company, typically 2-3 days per week. Unlike consultants who deliver reports, the Fractional CRO executes.
en.faq.q2: How much does a Fractional CRO cost?
en.faq.a2: Between $5,000 and $15,000 per month. The fractional model offers 70-80% of impact at 30-40% of cost.
en.faq.q3: When should I hire a Fractional CRO?
en.faq.a3: When your company has revenue between $1M-10M, growth has stalled for 6+ months, and CEO spends more than 40% of time on sales.
en.faq.q4: What's the difference between Fractional CRO and consulting?
en.faq.a4: Consulting delivers PowerPoints. Fractional CRO executes: participates in forecast meetings, trains reps, demands results.
en.faq.a5: We have a kill-switch on Day 30 and Day 90. If it's not working, we end without drama.

en.investors.subtitle: B2B Tech companies stuck in growth silently destroy value. Every quarter of stagnation compresses multiples and burns runway ‚Äî while the market doesn't wait.

en.investors.scorecard.title: üö® Scorecard: Does Your Portfolio Company Show These Signs?
en.investors.scorecard.subtitle: Check how many apply. 3+ signs = urgent intervention recommended.
en.investors.flag1.title: Flat Growth 6+ Months
en.investors.flag1.text: Stagnant ARR despite validated product and satisfied customers
en.investors.flag2.title: CEO in Sales Burnout
en.investors.flag3.title: Forecast Always Wrong
en.investors.flag3.text: Predictions miss by 25%+ consistently, negative quarter surprises
en.investors.flag4.title: High Sales Rep Churn
en.investors.flag4.text: Rep turnover above 30%/year, difficulty retaining talent
en.investors.flag5.title: Slipping Milestones
en.investors.flag5.text: 6-month targets becoming 9, then 12 ‚Äî without clear explanation
en.investors.flag6.title: Deteriorating Unit Economics
en.investors.flag6.text: CAC rising, LTV falling, payback period increasing
en.investors.scorecard.result: Result: If 3+ flags apply, your portfolio company likely has a GTM architecture problem, not a product or market one.
en.investors.cost.title: üí∏ The Real Cost of Inaction
en.investors.cost.intro: Every month of stagnation has compounding impact on your returns.
en.investors.cost1.title: Multiple Compression
en.investors.cost1.text: A $2M ARR company with 0% growth is worth 3-4x revenue. With 30%+ growth, it's worth 8-12x. Difference: $8-16M in equity.
en.investors.cost2.title: Burning Runway
en.investors.cost2.text: Every month of burn without growth pushes the company toward a forced down-round or emergency bridge that dilutes everyone.
en.investors.cost3.title: Exit Window Closing
en.investors.cost3.text: M&A and IPO markets don't wait. Buyers and public markets reward consistent growth, not turnarounds.
en.investors.cost4.title: Opportunity Cost
en.investors.cost4.text: GP hours in crisis mode are hours not spent on companies that are performing and need strategic support.

en.investors.case.title: ClearSale: Sales Structuring at the Beginning of the Journey
en.investors.case.subtitle: Mentorship in sales structuring that helped build the company's commercial foundation
en.investors.case.step1.title: The Challenge
en.investors.case.step1.text: ClearSale had a validated product and market, but needed to structure its sales operation to scale. Carlos Andr√© participated in defining and selecting the commercial leadership, serving as a close mentor to the operation.
en.investors.case.step2.title: The Mentorship
en.investors.case.step2.text: Strategic mentorship in structuring the commercial architecture: support in defining sales processes, pipeline, metrics and operational cadence. Close guidance that helped the company build a solid commercial foundation.
en.investors.case.step3.title: The Trajectory
en.investors.case.step3.text: With a solid commercial foundation, ClearSale became Brazil's anti-fraud leader, went public on B3 in 2021, and was acquired by Serasa Experian for R$2 billion (~$400M) in 2025.
en.investors.case.book.title: Documented in the book #VQD ‚Äî Vai Que D√°!
en.investors.case.book.detail: Endeavor Brazil / Portfolio Penguin, 2014. ClearSale chapter, with forewords by Jorge Paulo Lemann and Beto Sicupira.
en.investors.case.award.title: Impact Mentor Award ‚Äî Endeavor Brazil, 2013
en.investors.case.award.detail: Recognized after high-impact mentorships across 10+ companies in the Endeavor network.
en.investors.case.takeaway: The lesson for funds: The gap between validated product and scalable growth is almost always a commercial architecture problem. Solving it early changes the company's entire trajectory.

en.investors.faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
en.investors.faq.subtitle: Straight answers for GPs, Partners and Investment Teams
en.investors.faq.q1: How does the engagement model work with portfolio companies?
en.investors.faq.a1: We act as a dedicated Fractional CRO, with 2 days per week of direct involvement in operations. Typical engagement is 6-12 months, enough time to install the revenue architecture and train the internal team to operate autonomously. Unlike traditional consulting, we get into execution: we join client calls, structure the pipeline, define metrics, and build processes alongside the team.
en.investors.faq.q2: What is the ideal portfolio company profile for this service?
en.investors.faq.a2: Best fit: B2B Tech with validated product (paying and renewing customers), revenue between $1M-10M ARR, and growth stalled for 6+ months despite good product. Clear signals: Founder overwhelmed with sales, inconsistent pipeline, sales cycle lengthening, CAC rising without clear explanation. Not a fit: Pre-product-market-fit companies, B2C, or those needing product pivot (not GTM).
en.investors.faq.q3: What is the pricing and incentive structure?
en.investors.faq.a3: Hybrid model: monthly retainer + success fee tied to agreed metrics (typically qualified pipeline growth or revenue). The retainer covers dedicated time; the success fee aligns incentives. Kill-switch: If there is no measurable progress in 90 days, either party can terminate without penalty.
en.investors.faq.q4: What is the difference between Fractional CRO and hiring a VP of Sales?
en.investors.faq.a4: VP of Sales: 12-18 months ramp, cost of $150K-300K/year all-in, 50%+ failure rate in startups. Ideal when revenue architecture already exists. Fractional CRO: Results in 90 days, ~30% of VP cost, brings tested playbook. Ideal for building the architecture before hiring the VP. In practice: Fractional CRO builds the machine, then helps hire and onboard the VP who will operate it.
en.investors.faq.q5: How does reporting to the fund work?
en.investors.faq.a5: Structured monthly report with: pipeline metrics (volume, velocity, conversion), actions executed, blockers identified, and plan for next month. Quarterly call with the responsible board member for strategic alignment. Total transparency ‚Äî the fund has complete visibility of what is being done and the results.
en.investors.faq.q6: Can you work with more than one portfolio company simultaneously?
en.investors.faq.a6: Yes, but with limits. Maximum of 3 companies simultaneously to ensure execution depth. For funds with multiple portfolio companies needing support, we can discuss a partnership model with allocation priority and special conditions.
